p: An opportunity for improving the links between DRR and CCA in the context of sustainable development was identified with the overhaul of several key international policies in 2015 [ 24, 38, 39]. The Sendai Framework, Paris Agreement, 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and Sustainable Development Goals, and the New Urban Agenda were created in a time of increasing coherence between international policies [ 10, 16, 24, 40, 41]. They emphasize the need to work towards linking DRR and CCA in practice [ 10, 16, 24, 40, 41]. Since this time, there have been efforts through international platforms such as the Global Platform for Disaster Risk Reduction [ 42] and the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) technical expert meetings on adaptation [ 26], both in May 2017, to build an understanding about building these links in national policies and various sectors. However, health was not discussed, illustrating that there is limited recognition of the importance of building links in health.
